intro: Diodia polymorpha var. angulata, commonly known as angular diodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are angular and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are small and white, often clustered together, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
